title: A Fizz - Yasuo interaction
body:
So apparently Yasuo can no longer Windwall a Fizz ult, because Fizz can just throw a Max range ult at the windwall and it will drop and land on Yasuo due to the size.

This is either a hard counter or an unintended interaction for now.

replies.body:
So what you're saying is that for once, Yasuo is at a disadvantage?

Hallelujah for Fizz!

> [{quoted}](name=Lord Sesshomaru,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=VaaLt4dj,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-11-25T22:24:04.958+0000)
>
> So what you're saying is that for once, Yasuo is at a disadvantage?
> 
> Hallelujah for Fizz!

love that load of shit, yasuo is always at a disadvantage to everything, he does nothing unless the person using him is skillful.

Yeah someones never tried to play Velkoz, into Yasou, try it sometime, you'll have fun.

Yasou is overall very strong, he scales into the lategame extremely hard but still has an acceptable early game, he has a defensive ability most supports would die for, he has a dash that almost has no cooldown, he can do more damage than most adcs, he can outduel most champions in the game come midgame, he has the outplay potential to make is fairly possible to get a pentakill in a 1v5 if he's snowballed, a good yasou can basically solo carry the game if he can get snowballed. 

He does lack in what he provides to the team beyond raw damage, an ultimate which works well in wombocombo comps and some defensive utility when diving poke based comps, and he does kinda of force the team to have some knockups since even for a good yasou, getting a 5man knockup on his own is very rare. He can fall behind  pretty hard if beaten in lane and suffers pretty hard if the enemy jungler can catch him in the early levels, and this can make him pretty useless till he can catchup or get 2 completed items.

Yasou has a high base skill requirement but you get rewarded pretty hard for being able to meet this skill requirement. Imo Yasou has some matchups where a good yasou is nigh impossible to beat and other matchups where he is pretty much screwed unless he's arkadata. There is a reason Yasou is a staple of high ladder ranked matches, picked or banned in most matches regardless of meta. With the changes to assasssins, shifts in the toplane, midlane and adc's popular picks he's not doing too well at the moment but he still has an acceptable winrate and yasou mains have some of the highest winrates among players who one-trick champions.

Right now in the current meta; he's not really overpowered or broken, but he's still irritating to play against and whilst he does require alot of skill to be decent, he's by no means weak or disadvantaged.

please show me a legitimate bronze/silver who does well on yasuo more than 30% games.

SKT Yasuo

There ya go, search it.

please don't ever praise fizz, as irritating as yasou is, I'd much rather yasou be strong than the tanky little fish fucker who can 100-0 our toplane tank whilst tanking 3 ults to the face and still get out and live to spam emotes.
it has never been truly blockable, you have always been able to "block" the fish making it stop and drop but the ult would still go when it was time
The issue is a max range fizz ult will ALWAYS stick to a yasuo if he casts it in defense, because the shark is so big that when it drops it still latches on.
to be honest I feel the issue here isn't that yasou's windwall needs a buff, but more that rework fizz is stupid and broken.
It's too bad Yasuo wasn't able to move out of the way despite the fish reaching max range ;)
